name: fife
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a small flute (= a tube-shaped musical instrument held out sideways) with a high sound, used in military music: He played The Battle Hymn of the Republic on a fife.
ErikaMitchell/iStock/Getty Images Plus/GettyImages
More examplesFewer examplesEric Wallace of St. Louis, portraying a member of the 7th U.S. Infantry, plays his fife at Chalmette Battlefield.He led an eventful, wandering life, playing the fife and violin. Many boys would start their service as drummers or fife players, or as servants to officers, until they had grown enough to become full-fledged soldiers.A fife and drum corps opened the event.

an area of east central Scotland that was a council until 1975 and one of nine local government regions until 1996. It is now a council area (= an area with its own local government): Emmet grew up in Fife. Cupar is a small market town in Fife.
More examplesFewer examplesHe declares himself a Scot because his parents are from Fife.The player had a home he loved in Glenrothes, in Fife.According to tradition, Macbeth was killed by the Earl of Fife, Macduff.
